summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to a contractor, expressing appreciation for their work on two unspecified cases, one of which is referenced by the subject line 'WBTW/Epstein'.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The author of the email, expressing gratitude to a contractor for their work on cases including one related to Epstein.

persons.name: M, (USANYS) [Contractor]
persons.context: A contractor addressed in the email, recognized for their work on cases including one related to Epstein.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The AUSA is thanking the contractor for their work on cases, indicating a professional working relationship.

keyFacts: The email subject line references 'WBTW/Epstein', indicating work on a case related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The correspondence is dated July 13, 2020, showing ongoing case-related work years after Epstein's 2019 arrest.
The email is from an Assistant United States Attorney, confirming federal prosecutor involvement in Epstein-related matters.
The recipient is a contractor for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
The tone is appreciative, indicating significant effort had been expended on the cases.
